summary: This document is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) automated notification email indicating that an FBI agent in New York queried the TECS system for a lookout record on Jeffrey Epstein on February 25, 2021. It shows continued law enforcement interest in Epstein's records after his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a CBP notification that his Person Lookout Query record (P3N06596100A01) was accessed by an FBI user.

events.title: FBI queries CBP lookout record on Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: An FBI user accessed the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Person Lookout Query record for Jeffrey Epstein via the TECS system.

locations: New York (NY) (implied location of FBI user)
keyFacts: A law enforcement query was run on Jeffrey Epstein's CBP Person Lookout record (P3N06596100A01) on February 25, 2021.
The query was performed by an FBI user, indicating post-mortem investigative interest in Epstein's travel and border records.
The query was executed via the TECS (Treasury Enforcement Communications System) platform, a primary system for border and law enforcement lookouts.
The notification originated from CBP's National Targeting Center, which handles traveler screening and targeting.
